items.expandedDescription: Common arrows tipped with a Bronze head. Pointy!
Common arrows tipped with an Iron head. Heavy!
Well-crafted arrows tipped with a Steel head. A favorite of Bandits across Melvor.
Rare arrows tipped with a Mithril head. It can easily channel holy power.
Rare arrows tipped with an Adamant head. Popular among the people of the Arid Plains for their durability and penetrating power.
Powerful arrows tipped with a Runite head. Among the people of the Arid Plains, the use of Runite arrows is said to be the sign of a great Archer.
Devastating arrows tipped with a Dragonite head. The people of the Arid Plans tell legends of how these arrows were once used to kill a god.
An Arrow embed with the magic of the Deep South. Careful how you handle them.
Devastating arrows from a bygone era when gods walked the earth. Their production method has been lost to time.
Iron crossbow bolts tipped with splintered topaz. Careful of the edges!
Iron crossbow bolts tipped with splintered sapphire. Put a sparkle (and a bolt) in your enemy's eye!
Iron crossbow bolts tipped with splintered ruby. The red helps to hide the bloodstains.
Iron crossbow bolts tipped with splintered emerald. Don't worry, they're not poisoned!
Iron crossbow bolts with splintered diamond. The quickest way to your enemy's heart!
Iron crossbow bolts tipped with splintered Jadestone. Legend says they were designed by a Princess to kill her Dragon captor.
You found this in an old chest. It releases a scent that attracts fish.
An amulet enchanted to increase its wearer's strength. Instant Muscles!
An amulet enchanted to increase its wearer's reflexes. As you wear it, the world comes into clearer focus.
Amulet enchanted to harden your skin and protect the wearer from damage. Need some lotion?
An amulet enchanted to guide projectiles to their intended target. Banned in all Melvor sponsored athletic events.
An amulet enchanted to amplify magical energy. Runes not included.
A powerful amulet worn by only the most elite of knights. Both a badge of honor and a sign of duty.
As you don this amulet, your muscles swell and burst from your shirt. Do you even lift, bro?
I can see... EVERYTHING!
Skin of stone and bones of steel. Not even gods can bring you to heel.
The Whistling Bandit once used this to amulet to slay an entire pirate ship... with a single arrow.
The gods capped this after an enchanter used it to create a better one. Then he used that to make and even better one. And again, and again.
For when your glory is more glorious than the other guy's glory.
Each bead of this amulet is the polished scale of an ancient dragon, while the red gem is crystalized dragonfire.
An amulet used by a mysterious cult in profane rituals. You can hear souls of the trapped dead emanate from the gem at its center.

The Scales of Malcs are potent magical reagents. After absorbing the energy of several powerful magical amulets, this Amulet has obtained power not meant for mortal hands. - "By your powers combined! I am OP!"
Wearing this marks you as the Chief of the Pygmy spiders. Force them to bank your stuff.
This necklace was created by a necromancer who grew tired of cleaning up his messes. So he made his messes clean themselves up.
An enchanted amulet gifted to you by a fire spirit. As the flames die, you can spot flecks of gold among the ashes.
An enchanted amulet gifted to you by a fire spirit. The ash of the magic tree is said to hold small bits of cosmic power.
An enchanted amulet gifted to you by a fire spirit. The ashes of a fire, well tended, hold many uses.
An enchanted amulet gifted to you by a fire spirit. I'm not a pyromaniac, really!
The pairing of topaz and silver in this necklace sharpens your senses and lightens your blade.
Silver and sapphire work together to turn magical energy into healing power.
The warm ruby and chilling silver against your skin refreshes and strengthens your body.
Silver and emeralds are said to bring good luck. Both in finding lost arrows... and ensuring they find your enemy.
Why do silver and diamonds make you hit things harder with bit sticks? No one knows. It is one of the great mysteries of Melvor.
This necklace is rumoured to attract wealth, making it popular among the nobility.
Gold and Sapphire, when paired together, sharpen the mind and make it easier to spot on-coming projectiles.
Gold further improves the ruby's bolstering power, allowing it to heal quicker and to a greater extent.
Emeralds set in gold have long been used to detect hostile magics, making them popular among the roguish type.
Diamonds resonate with gold in the presence of magic to create a minor shield that can deflect the blow of a blade.
The greatest of Aeris' archers could hit a fly from 1000 meters. This diamond amulet was created in recognition of their skill. Rumored to hold a Virulent Poison.
The warlocks of Glacia city were said to drain the life out of their foes. All who wore this amulet eventually succumb to the Burning Madness.
An amulet gifted to provide protection in your most desperate moment. May its light Spike through the darkness and dispels all danger.
This magic amulet was worn by the gladiators of the Lord of Chaos. As they fought, their Relentless Fury fueled the forges of war.
A simple amulet with a small glass gem. Rumored to bring good luck.
Though fragile, thus unsuited for battle, this enchanted Amulet is popular among spell casters for its ability to increase the caster's speech.
Feathered arrows ready to be tipped. The art of fletching is as old as time.
Cleaned feathers from various winged creatures. Ready to flight arrows, or be brewed into potions.
Iron crossbow bolts designed to fit into a variety of firing mechanisms. The tips are fashioned to easily attach gem splinters, greatly increasing their power.
Various types of wood can be made into arrow shafts, though higher quality woods tend to show better results.
Arrowtips forged from bronze. Bronze may be soft, but so are your enemy's squishy bits.
Made from the iron mined in abundance from the east mountains, these arrow tips are some of the most popular in Melvor.
Hardened steel give these arrowtips exceptional penetration power, making them popular among bandits and adventurers alike.
The archers of the Holy Isles prefer mithril above all else for its exceptional ability to conduct holy power.
Adamant arrowtips are so prized among the tribes of the Arid Plains, that they are sometimes used in lieu of coinage.
Among the tribesmen of the Arid Plains, it is counted a great honor to dig a rune arrowtip from a wound. They are proof of facing a master archer and living to tell the tale.
For every great foe slain, an Arid Plains Chieftain will add a Dragonite Arrowtip to their headpiece. Both as a sign of honor... and a warning.
Small token used by Craftsmen around the world to trade favors among themselves. These can be used to have one such Craftsmen [Upgrade] a variety of useful Bags and Scrolls.
A hidden satchel in which to keep ill-gotten gold safe from the eyes of the law... or other sticky fingers.
New! From your friendly neighbors at Seed Co.! Our all-in-one Seed Pouches are guaranteed to increase your crop yield all year round!
This enchanted pouch creates Rune Essence out of thin air by absorbing the waste energy produced during Runecrafting.
A small pouch of basic Alchemical reagents designed to increase the effectiveness of a potion.
This enchanted satchel attracts gold like a magnet! Regardless if said gold belongs to you or not.
Vr. 2.0 from your friendly neighbors at Seed Co.! Now less* likely than ever to attract ravenous hordes of monstrous insects!
These rare Alchemical reagents can drastically increase the effects of a potion with little to no side-effects. They taste horrible, however.
A common natural whetstone. Stones like this are often carried by all types of people.
